title: Hector Thompson
text:
Hector Thompson ( – ) was an Australian professional <a href="boxer">boxer</a> who competed in four different <a href="Weight%20class%20%28boxing%29">weight divisions</a>—lightweight, super lightweight, welterweight and junior middleweight—during the 1970s and 80s.
Professional career.
In 1973 he beat <a href="Joe%20Tetteh">Joe Tetteh</a> for the Commonwealth (British Empire) Super lightweight title, earning a shot at <a href="Roberto%20Dur%C3%A1n">Roberto Durán</a> in 1973 for the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Association">World Boxing Association</a> World lightweight title but lost by <a href="Knockout%23Technical%20knockout">technical knockout</a> (TKO). After capturing the Commonwealth title again in 1975, later that year he would go on to challenge <a href="Antonio%20Cervantes">Antonio Cervantes</a> for the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Association">World Boxing Association</a> World light welterweight title but he lost by <a href="Corner%20retirement">RTD</a>. He was inducted into the <a href="Australian%20National%20Boxing%20Hall%20of%20Fame">Australian National Boxing Hall of Fame</a> in 2005. Two of Hector Thompson's opponents died after being TKOd by Thompson—<a href="Roko%20Spanja">Roko Spanja</a> in 1970 and <a href="Chuck%20Wilburn">Chuck Wilburn</a> in 1976.
